God will see to it that those who sow evil will reap evil.
Lord, I will offer myself freely, and everything I am I give to you.
Through you I’m saved—rescued from every trouble.

55.verse_text: God, listen to my prayer! Don’t hide your heart from me when I cry out to you! Here I am, moaning and restless. I’m preoccupied with the threats of my enemies and crushed by the pressure of their opposition. They surround me with trouble and terror. In their fury they rise up against me in an angry uproar. as the terror of death seizes me. If only I could run away to the place of rest and peace. escaping to a wilderness retreat.” Pause in his presence into my shelter, safe from this raging storm and tempest. Destroy them with their own violent strife and slander. They have divided the city with their discord. the real danger is within the city— the misery and strife in the hearts of its people. Wherever you turn, you find trouble and ruin. If it was my enemy, filled with pride and hatred, then I could have endured it. I would have just run away. I walked with and worked with! We worshiped in unity as one, May you and all those like you descend into the pit of destruction! Since evil has been your home, may evil now bury you alive! Every morning I will move my soul toward him. Every waking hour I will worship only him, and he will hear and respond to my cry. by your power I will be safe and secure; peace will be my portion. God-Enthroned through everlasting ages, the God of unchanging faithfulness— he will put them in their place, all those who refuse to love and revere him! Pause in his presence While he was stretching out his hand of friendship, he was secretly breaking every promise he had ever made to me! Yet his heart was disloyal and full of hatred— his words soft as silk while all the time scheming my demise. Leave all your cares and anxieties at the feet of the Lord, and measureless grace will strengthen you. never letting them slip or be overthrown. He will send all my enemies to the pit of destruction. Murderers, liars, and betrayers will face an untimely death. My life’s hope and trust is in you, and you’ll never fail to rescue me!
My heart is trembling inside my chest
Fear and dread overwhelm me. I shudder before the horror I face.
I say to myself, “If only I could fly away from all of this!
I would run far away where no one could find me,
I will hurry off to hide in the higher place,
God, confuse them until they quarrel with themselves.
Though they patrol the walls night and day against invaders,
Murder is in their midst.
It wasn’t an enemy who taunted me.
But it was you, my intimate friend—one like a brother to me. It was you, my adviser, the companion celebrating together with God’s people.
We once had sweet fellowship with each other.
Now desolation and darkness has come upon you.
But as for me, I will call upon the Lord to save me, and I know he will!
Every evening I will explain my need to him.
Though many wish to fight and the tide of battle turns against me,
God himself will hear me!
I was betrayed by my friend, though I lived in peace with him.
His words were smooth and charming.
So here’s what I’ve learned through it all:
He will watch over his devoted lovers,

56.verse_text: Lord, show me your kindness and mercy, for these men oppose and oppress me all day long. and trust in you with all my heart. With God on my side, I will not be afraid of what comes. The roaring praises of God fill my heart as I trust his promises. constantly they plot my collapse. to take me by surprise, ready to take my life. Look at their wickedness, their injustice, Lord. In your fierce anger cast them down to defeat. You’ve stored my many tears in your bottle—not one will be lost. the tide of battle turns and my enemies flee. This one thing I know: God is on my side! I trust in the Word of God. And I praise him! With God on my side, I will not be afraid of what comes. My heart overflows with praise to God and for his promises. I will always trust in him. with gratitude for all you’ve done. I will do everything I’ve promised you, Lord. and my feet from stumbling so that I can walk before the Lord
Not a day goes by without somebody harassing me. So many in their pride trample me under their feet. For they are all recorded in your book of remembrance. bathed in his life-giving light.
But in the day that I’m afraid, I lay all my fears before you
What harm could a man bring to me?
Day after day cruel critics distort my words;
They lurk in the dark, waiting, spying on my movements in secret
They don’t deserve to get away with this!
You’ve kept track of all my wandering and my weeping.
The very moment I call to you for a father’s help
I trust in the Lord. And I praise him!
What harm could man do to me?
So I’m thanking you with all my heart,
For you have saved my soul from death

57.verse_text: Please, God, show me mercy! Open your grace-fountain for me, for you are my soul’s true shelter. I will hide beneath the shadow of your embrace, under the wings of your cherubim, until this terrible trouble is past. the mighty God, who performs all these wonders for me. He will trample down those who trample me. Pause in his presence He will always show me love by his gracious and constant care. They are like lions just wanting to tear me to shreds. Why must I continue to live among these seething terrorists, breathing out their angry threats and insults against me? May your shining glory be seen in the skies! Let it be seen high above over all the earth! Frantic fear has me overwhelmed. But look! The very trap they set for me has sprung shut upon themselves instead of me! Pause in his presence Now I can sing with passion your wonderful praises! Arise, my soul, and sing his praises! My worship will awaken the dawn, greeting the daybreak with my songs of praise ! Among all the nations they will hear my praise songs to you. your faithfulness so astonishing it stretches to the sky! May your shining glory be shown in the skies! Let it be seen high above all the earth!
I will cry out to you, the God of the highest heaven,
From heaven he will send a father’s help to save me.
I am surrounded by these fierce and brutal men.
Lord God, be exalted as you soar throughout the heavens.
For they have set a trap for me.
My heart, O God, is quiet and confident.
Awake, O my soul, with the music of his splendor-song!
Wherever I go, I will thank you, my God.
Your love is so extravagant it reaches to the heavens;
Lord God, be exalted as you soar throughout the heavens.

58.verse_text: Like cobras closing their ears to the most expert of the charmers,
Let them disappear like water falling on thirsty ground.
Let them be like snails dissolving into the slime.
God will sweep them away so fast
The godly will celebrate in the triumph of good over evil,
Then everyone will say, “There is a God who judges the judges”

59.verse_text: My God, protect me! Keep me safe from all my enemies, for they’re coming to kill me. Put me in a high place out of their reach— a place so high that these assassins will never find me. They’re fierce men ready to launch their attack against me. O Lord, I’m innocent; protect me ! yet they are already plotting together to kill me. Arise, Lord, see what they’re scheming, and come and meet with me. Commander of Angel Armies, arise to punish these treacherous people who oppose you! Don’t go soft on these hard-core killers! Pause in his presence snarling, prowling like a pack of stray dogs in the night— convinced that they’ll never get caught. amused by their arrogance, scoffing at their sinful ways. Watch over me, God, for you are my mountain fortress; you set me on high! My God will empower me to rise in triumph over my foes. and scatter them with your armies of angels, O mighty God, our protector! Use your awesome power to make them wanderers and vagabonds and then bring them down. They sin in every word they speak, boasting in their blasphemies! Make an end of them and their deeds until they are no more! Let them all know and learn that God is the ruler over Jacob, the God-King over all the earth! Pause in his presence prowling, growling like a pack of stray dogs in the city. they refuse to sleep until they’ve eaten their fill. At each and every sunrise, my lyrics of your love will fill the air! For you have been my glory-fortress, a stronghold in my day of distress. O my stronghold, I sing with joy your song! O my Savior, I sing with joy the lyrics of your faithful love for me!
Save me from these murdering men, these bloodthirsty killers.
See how they set an ambush for my life.
I’ve done nothing to deserve this,
After dark they came to spy, sneaking around the city,
boiling over with rage, shouting out their curses,
But you, Lord, break out laughing at their plans,
My strength is found when I wait upon you.
The God of passionate love will meet with me.
Don’t kill them; stagger them all with a vivid display of power
They are nothing but proud, cursing liars.
May your wrath be kindled to destroy them; finish them off!
Drifting, devouring, and coming in for the kill,
But as for me, your strength shall be my song of joy.
O my strength, I sing with joy your praises.

60.verse_text: God, it seems like you walked off and left us! Why have you turned against us? You have been angry with us. O Lord, we plead, come back and help us as a father . splitting open and breaking apart. Now come and heal it, for it is shaken to its depths. and made us drink the wine of bewilderment. As we follow you, we fly the flag of truth, and all who love the truth will rally to it. Pause in his presence For Lord, you save those whom you love. Come with your might and strength! From his sanctuary I heard the Lord promise: “In my triumph I will be the one to measure out the portion of my inheritance to my people, and I will secure the land as I promised you. Shechem, Succoth, Gilead, Manasseh, they are all still mine!” he says. “Judah will continue to produce kings and lawgivers, and Ephraim will produce great warriors. Edom will likewise serve my purposes. I will lift up a shout of victory over the land of Philistia! For to trust in any man is an empty hope. and he will trample down our every foe!
The earth quivers and quakes before you,
You have taught us hard lessons
You have given miraculous signs to those who love you.
Come to your beloved ones and gently draw us out.
Moab will become my lowly servant.
But who will bring my triumph into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom’s fortresses?”
Have you really rejected us, refusing to fight our battles?
Give us a father’s help when we face our enemies.
With God’s help we will fight like heroes,

61.verse_text: O God, hear my prayer. Listen to my heart’s cry.

For no matter where I am, even when I’m far from home, I will cry out to you for a father’s help. When I’m feeble and overwhelmed by life, guide me into your glory, where I am safe and sheltered. You lift me high above the fray. None of my foes can touch me when I’m held firmly in your wraparound presence! Let me live continually under your splendor-shadow, hiding my life in you forever. Pause in his presence to love and serve you, for I am your beloved. And you have given me an inheritance of rich treasures, which you give to all your devoted lovers. like many generations rolled into one. Guard me, God, with your unending, unfailing love. Let me live my days walking in grace and truth before you. fulfilling my vow to make every day a love-gift to you!
Lord, you are a paradise of protection to me.
You have heard my sweet resolutions
You treat me like a king, giving me a full and abundant life, years and years of reigning,
I will live enthroned with you forever!
And my praises will fill the heavens forever,

62.verse_text: I stand silently to listen for the one I love, waiting as long as it takes for the Lord to rescue me. For God alone has become my Savior. his wraparound presence always protects me. For he is my champion defender; there’s no risk of failure with God. So why would I let worry paralyze me, even when troubles multiply around me? shouting their vicious threats at me! The moment they discover my weakness, they all begin plotting to take me down. all their energies are spent on moving me from this exalted place. Pause in his presence waiting as long as it takes for him to rescue me. Only God is my Savior, and he will not fail me. His wraparound presence always protects me as my champion defender. There’s no risk of failure with God! So why would I let worry paralyze me, even when troubles multiply around me? His wraparound presence is all I need, for the Lord is my Savior, my hero, and my life-giving strength. Tell him all your troubles and pour out your heart-longings to him. Believe me when I tell you—he will help you! Pause in his presence are like smoke that disappears, like a vapor that quickly vanishes away. Compared to God they’re nothing but vanity, nothing at all! So if your wealth increases, don’t be boastful or put your trust in your money. And don’t you think for a moment that you can get away with stealing by overcharging others just to get more for yourself! “All the strength and power you need flows from me!” And again I heard it clearly said, And it’s true that you repay people for what they do.
He alone is my safe place;
But look at these who want me dead,
Liars, hypocrites, with nothing good to say—
I am standing in absolute stillness, silent before the one I love,
For he alone is my safe place.
God’s glory is all around me!
Trust only in God every moment!
Before God all the people of the earth, high or low,
The wealth of the world is nothing to God.
God said to me once and for all,
“All the love you need is found in me!”

63.verse_text: O God of my life, I’m lovesick for you in this weary wilderness. I thirst with the deepest longings to love you more, with cravings in my heart that can’t be described. Such yearning grips my soul for you, my God! your heavenly sanctuary to seek more of your power and drink in more of your glory. How I love and praise you, God! My arms will wave to you like banners of praise. for the anointing of your presence satisfies me like nothing else. You are such a rich banquet of pleasure to my soul. and reflecting on how you help me like a father. I sing through the night under your splendor-shadow, offering up to you my songs of delight and joy! Because I feel your grip on my life, I keep my soul close to your heart. But with the anointing of a king I will dance and rejoice along with all his devoted lovers who trust in him.
I’m energized every time I enter
For your tender mercies mean more to me than life itself.
Daily I will worship you passionately and with all my heart.
I overflow with praise when I come before you,
With passion I pursue and cling to you.
Those who plot to destroy me shall descend into the darkness of hell.
They will be consumed by their own evil and become nothing more than dust under our feet.
These liars will be silenced forever!

64.verse_text: They persist with their evil plans
They search out opportunities to pervert justice They try desperately to hide the deep darkness of their hearts.
But all the while God has his own fire-tipped arrows!
Staggering backward, they will be destroyed
Then all will stand awestruck over what God has done,
The lovers of God will be glad, rejoicing in the Lord.

65.verse_text: Though we are overcome by our many sins,
How blessed is the one you choose
You answer our prayers with amazing wonders
What jaw-dropping, astounding power is yours!
You muzzle the roar of the mighty seas
O God, to the farthest corners of the planet
Your visitations of glory bless the earth;
Every field is watered with the abundance of rain—
You crown the earth with the fruits of your goodness.
Luxuriant green pastures boast of your bounty
The grazing meadows are covered with flocks,

66.verse_text: Everyone everywhere, lift up your joyful shout to God!

Sing your songs tuned to his glory! Tell the world how wonderful he is. We’ve never seen anything like him! Mighty in miracles, you cause your enemies to tremble. No wonder they all surrender and bow before you! all the earth will sing your glories forever! Pause in his presence it will take your breath away! as the Hebrews passed through on dry ground, exploding with joyous excitement over the miracles of God. watching over every movement of every nation. So beware, rebel lands; he knows how to humble you! Pause in his presence Praise him everywhere and let everyone know you love him! He’s the one who keeps us faithfully following him. like precious metal made pure, you’ve proved us, perfected us, and made us holy. We’ve passed through fire and flood, yet in the end you always bring us out better than we were before, I’ll give you all that I’ve promised, everything I have. I promised to give you my sacrifice. Here it is! All that I said I would offer you is yours. Pause in his presence come and listen, and I’ll tell you what he did for me. Now my mouth overflows with the highest praise. the Lord God would have closed his ears to my prayer. for he paid attention to my prayer and answered my cry to him! and never said no when I asked him for help. He never once refused to show me his tender love.
For he’s the awe-inspiring God, great and glorious in power!
All the earth will bow down to worship;

Everyone will say, “Come and see the incredible things God has done; He multiplies miracles for his people!” Then, like prisoners, you placed chains around our necks . saturated with your goodness. as the fragrance of my sacrifice ascends unto you.
He made a highway going right through the Red Sea
In his great and mighty power he rules forever,
Praise God, all you peoples.
There’s no doubt about it: God holds our lives safely in his hands.
O Lord, we have passed through your fire;
You’ve captured us, ensnared us in your net.
You’ve allowed our enemies to prevail against us.
I come before your presence with my sacrifice.
When I was overcome in my anguish,
I’ll throw it all—the best I have to bring—into the fire
All you lovers of God who want to please him,
I cried aloud to him with all my heart, and he answered me!
Yet if I had closed my eyes to my sin,
But praises rise to God,
I will forever praise this God who didn’t close his heart when I prayed

67.verse_text: God, keep us near your mercy-fountain and bless us! And when you look down on us, may your face beam with joy! Let all the people praise you more! Pause in his presence will discover your ways and know who you are and see your power to save. let everyone everywhere love and enjoy you! They will sing, they will shout, for you give true justice to the people. Yes! You, Lord, are the shepherd of the nations! Pause in his presence God, the very God we worship, keeps us satisfied at his banquet of blessings. All the ends of the earth will give him the honor he deserves and be in awe of him!
Send us out all over the world so that everyone everywhere
Let all the nations burst forth with praise;
Then how glad the nations will be when you are their King.
No wonder the peoples praise you!
The harvest of the earth is here!

68.verse_text: God! Arise with awesome power, and every one of your enemies will scatter in fear! Blow them away as a puff of smoke. Melt them away like wax in the fire. One good look at you and the wicked vanish. Yes, let them all rejoice in your presence Let them laugh and be radiant with joy! To the widow he is a champion friend. The lonely he makes part of a family. This is our Holy God in his Holy Place! leading them through the wasteland. Pause in his presence before the presence of the God of Sinai. The sacred mountain shook at the sight of the face of Israel’s God. showers of blessing to refresh it. Look at them flee!” Now Zion’s women are left to gather the spoils. I see you sparkling like silver and glistening like gold, All the other peaks, though impressive and imposing, look with envy on you, Mount Zion! For Zion is the mountain where God has chosen to live forever. Ten thousands upon ten thousands, more than anyone could ever number. God is at the front, leading them all from Mount Sinai into his sanctuary taking his many captured ones with him, leading them in triumphal procession. And gifts were given to men, even the once rebellious, so that they may dwell with Yah. Pause in his presence For the Lord, Yahweh, rescues us from the ways of death many times. He will make heads roll for they refuse to repent of their stubborn, sinful ways. “You’d better come out of your hiding places, Don’t you know there’s no place to hide? they will soon have you under their feet. keep moving onward in holiness; you’re moving onward toward the Holy Place! with young maidens in between, striking their tambourines. Let all the congregations bring their blessing to God, saying, ‘The Lord of the fountain! The Lord of the fountain of life! The Lord of the fountain of Israel!’ ” princes of praise in their royal robes and exalted princes are among them, along with princes who have wrestled with God. For your miracles have made us who we are. Lord, do it again and parade from your temple your mighty power. By your command even kings will bring gifts to you. who lurk within the congregation and abuse the people out of their love for money. God scatters the people who are spoiling for a fight. They will come running, stretching out their hands in love to you. Go ahead, all you nations—sing your praise to the Lord! Pause in his presence Listen to his thunderous voice of might split open the heavens. Proclaim his majesty! For his glory shines down on Israel. His mighty strength soars in the clouds of glory. as your glory streams from your Holy Place. The God of power shares his mighty strength with Israel and with all his people. God, we give our highest praise to you!
Chase them away—all these God-haters.

But let all the righteous be glad! and be carried away with gladness. for the coming of the cloud rider whose name is Yah! The prisoners he leads into prosperity until they sing for joy. But for the rebels there is heartache and despair. And in your kindness you provided the poor with abundance. and the warring women of Zion deliver its message: covered by the beautiful wings of a dove! it became white as snow in his shade. you are the mighty kingdom of God! with the radiance of holiness upon him. He gives us salvation over and over, then daily he carries our burdens! all of you who are doing your best to stay far away from me. They will crush you until there is nothing left!” Rebuke those who claim to be “strong ones,”
Let them sing their celebration-songs
O Lord, it was you who marched in front of your people,
The earth shook beneath your feet; the heavens filled with clouds
You, O God, sent the reviving rain upon your weary inheritance,
So there your people settled.
God Almighty declares the word of the gospel with power,
“The conquering legions have themselves been conquered.
When you sleep between sharpened stakes,
When the Almighty found a king for himself,
Look! The mighty chariots of God!
He ascends into the heavenly heights,
What a glorious God!
Our God is a mighty God who saves us over and over!
But he will crush every enemy, shattering their strength.
I hear the Lord God saying to all the enemies of his people,
For my people will be the conquerors;
O God, my King, your triumphal processions
Leaders in front, then musicians,
And they sing, “Let all God’s princely people rejoice!
Astonishingly, it’s the favored youth leading the way:
God, rebuke the beast-life that hides within us!
Africa will send her noble envoys to you, O God.
Let all the nations of the earth sing songs of praise to Almighty God!
Make music for the one who strides the ancient skies.
Give it up for God, for he alone has all the strength and power!
God, we are consumed with awe, trembling before you

69.verse_text: I’m weary, exhausted with weeping.
I can’t even count all those who hate me for no reason.
God, my life is an open book to you.
Lord Yahweh of Angel Armies,
Because of my love for you, Lord,
Even my own brothers, those of my family,
My love for you has my heart on fire!
When they see me seeking for more of you with weeping and fasting,
When I humble myself with sorrow over my sin,
The leaders, the influential ones—how they scorn my passion for you!
But I keep calling out to you, Yahweh!
Pull me out of this mess! Don’t let me sink!
Don’t let this flood drown me.
Come closer as a friend and redeem me.
See how they dishonor me in shame and disgrace?
I’m heartsick and heartbroken by it all.
I was hungry and they gave me bitter food.
Let their “feasts” turn to ashes.
Make them blind as bats, groping in the dark.
For they come against the one you yourself have struck,
Pile on them the guilt of their sins.
Leave them out of your list of the living!
I am burdened and broken by this pain.
Then my song will be a burst of praise to you.
For I know, Yahweh, that my praises mean more to you
All who seek you will see God do this for them,
For Yahweh does listen to the poor and needy
Let all the universe praise him!
God will come to save his Zion-people.
All their children will inherit the land,

70.verse_text: Please, Lord! Come quickly and rescue me! God, show me your favor and restore me. God, send them sprawling, all who wish me evil; they just want me dead. Let them be ashamed and horrified over their complete defeat. over what you’ve done! say aloud, “How great and glorious is our God!” won’t you turn your heart toward me and hurry to help me? For you are my Savior, and I’m always in your thoughts. So don’t delay to deliver me now, for you are my God.
Let all who seek my life be humiliated and confused.
Scoff at every scoffer and cause them all to be utter failures!
But let all who passionately seek you erupt with excitement and joy Let all your devoted lovers, who continually rejoice in the Savior,
Lord, in my place of weakness and need,

71.verse_text: Lord, you are my secure shelter. Don’t ever let me down!

Let your justice be my breakthrough. Bend low to my whispered cry and save me from all my enemies! I keep coming back to hide myself in you, for you are like a mountain-cliff fortress where I’m kept safe. and save me from the hands of the evil one. I’ve hung on to you, trusting in you all my life. loving me, helping me through my life’s journey. You’ve made me into a miracle; no wonder I trust you and praise you forever! Many marvel at my success, but I know it is all because of you, my mighty protector! and your splendor thrills me all day long. Don’t let go of me when my strength is spent. They’re waiting for me to fall so they can finish me off. They’re convinced you’ve left me and that you’ll never come to my rescue. They’re saying, “Let’s get him now! He has no savior!” Don’t just watch from a distance! Hurry to help me, my God! Destroy them all, for they only want to kill me! Nothing will stop me from praising you to magnify your glory! With the skill of a poet I’ll never run out of things to say about how you faithfully kept me from danger. I’ll tell everyone that you alone are the perfect one. and I’m still telling everyone of your miracle-wonders! Give me grace to demonstrate to the next generation all your mighty miracles and your excitement, to show them your magnificent power! No one could ever be compared to you! Who is your equal, O God of marvels and wonders? I know you will revive us again, lifting us up from the dust of death. Turn and comfort us once again. Your faithful heart toward us will be the theme of my song. Melodies and music will rise to you, the Holy One of Israel. Savior, lover of my soul! while all those who seek my harm slink away ashamed and defeated!
You’re the only place of protection for me.
Let me escape from these cruel and wicked men,
For you are my only hope, Lord!
I’m overflowing with your praise for all you’ve done,
Now that I’m old, don’t set me aside.
O God, stay close to me!
Cover these accusers of mine with shame and failure!
No matter what, I’ll trust in you to help me.
I couldn’t begin to count the times you’ve been there for me.
I will come forth in your mighty strength, O my Lord God.
From my childhood you’ve been my teacher,
God, now that I’m old and gray, don’t walk away.
For your glorious righteousness reaches up to the high heavens.
Even though you’ve let us sink down with trials and troubles,
Give us even more greatness than before.
My loving God, the harp in my heart will praise you.
I will shout and sing your praises for all you are to me—
I’ll never stop telling others how perfect you are,

72.verse_text: O God, make the king a godly judge like you and give the king’s son the gift of justice too. honorably and equally to all. and from your righteousness prosperity and peace will flow to all the people. May he consider the children of the poor and crush the cruel oppressor. before your devoted lovers will stop worshiping; for ages upon ages the people will love and adore you! like showers reviving the earth. with the abundance of peace and prosperity forevermore. may he rule from the river to the rim. every enemy is falling facedown, biting the dust! from every continent and coastland; they will offer their tribute to you. O King of kings, every nation will one day serve you. when they cry to him for help. The humble and helpless will know his kindness, for with a father’s compassion he will save their souls. for their lifeblood is precious in his eyes. May there be ceaseless praise and prayer to him. May all the blessing be brought to him. with golden grain swaying on the mountain fields! May the cities be full of praising people, fruitful and filled— May the fame of his name spring forth! May it shine on, like the sunshine! In him all will be blessed to bless others, and may all the people bless the One who blessed them. He is the one and only God of wonders, surpassing every expectation. May all the earth overflow with his glory! Faithful is our King! Amen!
Help him to give true justice to your people,
Then the mountains of influence will be fruitful,
May the poor and humble have an advocate with the king.
The sun and moon will stop shining
Your favor will fall like rain upon our surrendered lives,
In the days of his reign the righteous will spring forth
May he subdue and take dominion from sea to sea;
Desert nomads are bowing at his feet;
Distant kings will surrender and come with their gifts
O King of kings, they will all bow before you.
They will be rescued from tyranny and torture,
Long live this King! May the wealth of the world be laid before him.
Bless us with a bountiful harvest,
so that his name may be honored forever!
Praise Yahweh forever, the God of Israel!
The blazing glory of his name will be praised forever!
This concludes the poetry sung by David, Jesse’s son.

73.verse_text: No one can deny it—God is really good to Israel and to all those with pure hearts. But I nearly missed seeing it for myself . For when I saw the boasters with such wealth and prosperity, I became jealous over their smug security. doing what they wanted, and with no care in the world, no pain, no problems—they seemed to have it made. They lived as though life would never end. Cruelty and violence are parts of their lifestyle. they overflow with vanity. They even scoff at God! They are nothing but bullies threatening God’s people. windbags full of hot air, impressing only themselves. to more of their nonsense. See, he has no clue of what we’re doing.” They never have to lift a finger, living a life of ease while their riches multiply. I feel like I’m being punished all day long. it would have sounded like unfaithfulness to the next generation. It was too puzzling—too much of a riddle to me. and in the light of glory, my distorted perspective vanished. Then I understood that the destiny of the wicked was near! and God will suddenly let them slide off into destruction to be consumed with terrors forever! a blink of the eye and they’re swept away by sudden calamity! They’re all nothing more than momentary monarchs— When the rooster crows, piercing my opinions with your truth. acting like a brute beast before you, Lord. you hold me by my right hand. And following you brings me into your brightness and glory! No one on earth means as much to me as you. But when I trust in you, I have a strong and glorious presence protecting and anointing me. Forever you’re all I need! The false and unfaithful will be silenced, never heard from again. for your name is good to me. I’ll keep telling the world of your awesome works, my faithful and glorious God!
Here’s my story: I narrowly missed losing it all.
I was stumbling over what I saw the wicked doing.
They didn’t even try to hide their pride and opulence.
Pampered and pompous, vice oozes from their souls;
They’re such snobs—looking down their noses.
They are loudmouths with no fear of God, pretending to know it all—
Yet the people keep coming back to listen
They tell their cohorts, “God will never know.
These are the wicked ones I’m talking about!
Have I been foolish to play by the rules and keep my life pure?
Here I am suffering under your discipline day after day.
If I had given in to my pain and spoken of what I was really feeling,
When I tried to understand it all, I just couldn’t.
But then one day I was brought into the sanctuaries of God,
They’re the ones who are on the slippery path,
It will be an instant end to all their life of ease;
soon to disappear like a dream when one awakes. Lord God, you’ll despise their life of fantasies.
When I saw all of this, what turmoil filled my heart,
I was so stupid. I was senseless and ignorant,
Yet, in spite of all this, I still belong to you;
You lead me with your secret wisdom.
Whom have I in heaven but you? You’re all I want!
Lord, so many times I fail; I fall into disgrace.
Those who abandon the worship of God will perish.
But I’ll keep coming closer and closer to you, Lord Yahweh,

74.verse_text: Are you really going to leave us, God? Would you turn your back on us, rejecting your people? Will your anger smolder against us forever? Wrap us back into your heart again, for you chose us. You brought us out of our slavery and bondage and made us your favored ones, your Zion-people, your home on earth. to what the enemy has done to devastate your Holy Place. roaring like beasts, setting up their banners to flaunt their conquest. Like a forest chopped down to the ground, there’s nothing left. of the inner place has been ruined, They’ve violated your sanctuary, the very dwelling place of your glory and your name. Let’s wipe out every trace of this God. Let’s burn up every sacred place where they worship this God.” There’s no longer a prophet among us who can tell us how long this devastation will continue. and allow these barbarians to blaspheme your name? Will you stand back and watch them get away with this forever? You have the power to break in, so why would you hide your great power from us? Don’t hold back! Unleash your might and give them a final blow. You are the mighty conqueror, working wonders all over the world. You smashed the power of Tannin, the sea monster. then you took the crumbs and fed them to the sharks. then you spoke, and the ever-flowing springs of Jordan dried up so we could cross over. Sunlight and starlight call you Creator. and every changing season owes its beauty to you. like fools, have mocked your name. Protect us from these wild beasts who want to harm us. Don’t leave us as lambs among wolves! You can’t abandon us after all we’ve been through! for darkness covers the land, giving the violent ones a hiding place. Can’t you see that we are your downtrodden and oppressed people? Make the poor and needy into a choir of praise to you! Rise up, God; it’s time to defend yourself from all this. For their rage and uproar rise continually against you. It’s time to stand up to them! We are yours, your very own. Come running to bring your restoring grace to these ruins, smashed, broken, and shattered.
Don’t forget that we are your beloved ones.
Turn your steps toward this devastation.
They have come into the very midst of your dwelling place,
Now everything is in shambles! They’ve totally destroyed it.
All of the beauty of the craftsmanship
They’ve burned it all to the ground.
They boasted, “Let’s completely crush them!

God, how much longer will you let this go on

You crushed the might of Leviathan, the great dragon,
With your glory you opened up springs and fountains,
You own the day and the night.
The four corners of the earth were formed by your hands,
O Yahweh, don’t ever forget how these arrogant enemies,
Lord, aren’t we your beloved dove that praises you?
Remember your promises to us,
Don’t let these insults continue.
Don’t ignore these ignorant words, this continual mocking.
Never forget what your adversaries are saying.

Over and over I kept looking for you, God, but your comforting grace was nowhere to be found. I’m overwhelmed with despair as I wait for your help to arrive. Lord, what wounds me most is that it’s somehow my fault that or your right hand of power. where I learn more of your ways, with footprints on a pathway no one even knew was there.

The story of Israel is a lesson in God’s ways.
For perpetuity God’s ways will be passed down
In this way, every generation will set its hope in God
By following his ways they will break the past bondage
Take, for example, the sons of Ephraim.
They didn’t really believe the promises of God;
They forgot his wonderful works and the miracles of the past,
even their exodus from Egypt, the epic miracle of his might.
God split the sea wide open, and
By day the moving glory-cloud led them forward.
Yet they kept their rebellion alive against God Most High,
In their hearts they tested God just to get what they wanted,
Then God heard all their complaining and was furious!
For they turned away from faith and walked away in fear;
Humans ate angels’ food—the meal of the mighty ones.
Food fell from the skies, thick as clouds;
He gave them all they desired, and they ate to their fill.
Yet in spite of all this, they kept right on sinning.
So God cut their lives short with sudden disaster,
When he cared for them they ignored him ,
They remembered that God, the Mighty One,
But amazingly, God—so full of compassion—still forgave them.
He knew that they were made from mere dust—
How many times they rebelled in their desert days!
Again and again they limited God, preventing him from blessing them.
They forgot his great love, how he took them by his hand,
They disregarded all the epic signs and marvels they saw
God turned their rivers into blood, leaving the people thirsty.
He sent them vast swarms of filthy flies that sucked their blood.
Grasshoppers consumed all their crops.
Every garden and every orchard
Even their cattle fell prey, pounded by the falling hail;
Finally, he unleashed upon them the fierceness of his anger.
Then, like a shepherd leading his sheep, God led his people
Safely and carefully God led them out, with nothing to fear.
Eventually God brought his people to the Holy Land,
He drove out and scattered all the peoples occupying the land,
Yet for all of this, they still rebelled and refused to follow his ways,
Enraged with anger, God turned his wrath on them,
God walked away from them and left his dwelling place at Shiloh,
allowing his emblem of strength, his glory-ark, to be captured.
God vented his rage, allowing his people to be butchered
Their young men fell on the battlefield and never came back.
Their priests were slaughtered and their widows were killed
Then all at once the Almighty awakened
He blasted into battle, driving back every foe,
He rejected Joseph’s family, the tribe of Ephraim.
He chose instead the tribe of Judah
There he built his towering temple,
God also chose his beloved one, David.

I turn to you in faith, my God, my hero; come and rescue me! show me your favor and bring me to your fountain of grace! for all I am is yours, O God. and ready to forgive, for your grace-fountain keeps overflowing, drenching all your devoted lovers who pray to you. Lord, bend down to listen to my prayer. for I know your help is on the way. there’s no other god as famous as you. You outshine all others, and your miracles make it easy to know you. May the Lord take joy and pleasure in all that he has made. just a touch of his finger and volcanoes erupt as the earth shakes and melts. Every day I will sing my praises to God. for you are the source of my joy and gladness. But I will keep on praising you, my Lord, with all that is within me. My joyous, blissful shouts of “Hallelujah” are all because of you! overwhelming me by your majesty, beauty, and splendor! men and beasts have their thirst quenched because of you. Your goodness brings forth fruit for all to enjoy. giving us glowing health for our bodies.
You wrap yourself with a shimmering, glistening light.
You build your balconies with light beams
You make your messengers into winds of the Spirit,
You, our Creator, formed the earth,
You poured the ocean depths over the planet,
Yet at the sound of your thunder-shout
The mountains rose and valleys sank
Then you set a boundary line for the seas
You sent springs cascading through the valleys,
You provide drink for every living thing;
The birds build nests near the tranquil streams,
From your kindness you send the rain to water the mountains
Your compassion brings the earth’s harvest, feeding the hungry.
You provide sweet wine to gladden hearts.
The trees of the Lord drink until they’re satisfied.
Within their branches you provide for birds
You make the high mountains a home for wild goats
You made the moon to mark the months
You turn off the light and it becomes night,
The mighty lions roar for their dinner,
At sunrise they slink back to their dens
Then man goes out to his labor and toil,
O Lord, what an amazing variety of all you have created!
And then there is the sea! So vast! So wide and deep—
Trading ships glide through the high seas.
All the creatures wait expectantly for you
You come near and they all gather around,
But if you were to withhold from them and turn away,
When you release your Spirit-Wind, life is created,
May God’s glorious splendor endure forever!
For the earth’s overseer has the power to make it tremble;
I will sing my song to the Lord as long as I live!
May you be pleased with every sweet thought I have about you,
Now, let all the sinners be swept from the earth.

He satisfied them with heaven’s bread falling from the sky. and the waters poured out like a river in the desert. his holy promise to his servant Abraham. with a joyful shout they were set free! Fruitful lands of crops they had never planted were now theirs. to keep the ways of God, obeying his laws and following his truths. Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!

For he is the Lord our God, and his wise authority can be seen in all he does. He has kept every promise he made to Abraham and to Isaac. and from one kingdom to another. came from Canaan to Egypt and settled in Goshen. the pride and joy of every Egyptian family. And not even one was feeble on their way out!
His promises have become an everlasting covenant to Jacob,
He said to them, “I will give you all the land of Canaan
They were very few in number
They were wandering from one land to another
Yet God would not permit anyone to touch them,
He said to them, “Don’t you dare lay a hand on my anointed ones,
So God decreed a famine upon Canaan-land,
But he had already sent a man ahead of his people to Egypt;
His feet were bruised by strong shackles
God’s promise to Joseph purged his character
Eventually, the king of Egypt sent for him, setting him free at last.
Then Joseph was put in charge of everything under the king;
Pharoah gave him authority over all the princes of the land,
Then Jacob, with all of Joseph’s family,
God made them very fruitful, and they multiplied incredibly
God turned their hearts to hate his people
But he sent them his faithful servant, Moses, the deliverer,
Their command brought down signs and wonders,
By God’s direction, they spoke and released a plague
God turned their rivers to blood, causing every fish to die.
And the judgment-plague of frogs came in enormous numbers,
God spoke and another plague was released—
God rained down hail and flaming fire upon Egypt.
Their gardens and vines were all destroyed,
God spoke, and devouring hordes of locusts swept over the land,
picking the ground clean of vegetation and crops.
Then God struck down their firstborn sons,
At last, God freed all the Hebrews from their slavery
Egypt was relieved at their exodus, ready to see them go,
God spread out a cloud as shade as they moved ahead
Moses prayed and God brought them quail to eat.
He broke open the boulder
For God could never forget
So God brought out his chosen ones with singing;
He gave them lands and nations, just like he promised.
All this was done for them so that they would be faithful

Over and over you showed them such tender love and mercy! Yet they were barely beyond the Red Sea when they rebelled against you. so they would know how powerful you are, showing them the honor of your name. making a dry path for your people to cross through. of those who oppressed them and rescued them from bondage. not one survived. and they all broke out with songs of praise! They wouldn’t wait for you to act when they were hungry, They tested you to the breaking point. but their souls starved away to nothing. Dathan and Abiram along with their followers. turning them to ashes. and bowed to worship their man-made statue. to the presence of the glory-filled God. by the wonders and awesome miracles you worked in Egypt. But Moses, your chosen leader, stood in the gap between you and the people and made intercession on their behalf to turn away your wrath from killing them all. and they despised the land of delight you gave to them. and closed their hearts to your voice. that they would all die in the desert. of the false god named “Lord of the Pit.” They even ate the sacrifices offered to the dead! It made you so angry that a plague broke out among them! Phineas will be remembered forever. This is where Moses got into serious trouble! Moses exploded in anger and spoke to them out of his bitterness. as you had commanded them. and learned to copy their works of darkness. All of this led them away from you and brought about their downfall. These dark practices greatly defiled the land and their own souls, through the murder and bloodshed of their own babies! Their sins made them spiritual adulterers before you. The happiest one on earth is the one who keeps your word

Our fathers who were delivered from Egypt

but demanded you satisfy their cravings and give them food!

You split open the earth, and it swallowed up
Fire fell from heaven and burnt up all the band of rebels,

Then our fathers joined the worshipers

It continued until Phineas intervened and executed the guilty for causing judgment to fall upon them. at the stream called Strife.
Because of this deed of righteousness
Your people also provoked you to wrath

Tell the world how he broke through and delivered you from the power of darkness and has gathered us together from all over the world. He has set us free to be his very own! with no true direction or dwelling place. we became desperate and filled with despair. until we reached a suitable city to dwell in. and for all his miracles of mercy for those he loves. and fills the hungry with goodness! living in the dark shadows of death. We were prisoners to our pain, chained to our regrets. and rejected the wise counsel of God Most High. watching us as we stumbled, with no one there to pick us back up. Our own pain became our punishment. he led us out in freedom from death’s dark shadow and snapped every one of our chains. and for his miracles of mercy for those he loves! shattered the steel bars that held us back, just to set us free! sorrow and suffering all because of our sins. we drew near to the gates of death. delivered from death’s door! and for his miracles of mercy for those he loves! as you sing your story of miracles with a joyful song. transporting our goods from ship to shore. we saw breathtaking wonders upon the high seas. lifting high the waves with hurricane winds. then dropping down to the depths, reeling like drunkards, spinning like tops, everyone at their wits’ end until even sailors despaired of life, cringing in terror. and he hushed the hurricane winds to only a whisper. safely to harbor in a quiet haven. and for his miracles of mercy for those he loves! let all the people and the leaders of the nation know how great and wonderful is Yahweh, our God! and turn the land into a desert. all because of the wickedness of those who dwell there. His light broke through the darkness and

and turn them into fertile valleys so that cities spring up,

108.verse_text: My heart, O God, is focused and determined. Now I can sing my song with passionate praises! Awake, O my soul, with the music of his splendor. I will awaken the dawn with my worship, greeting the daybreak with my songs of light . All the nations will hear my praise songs to you. Your faithfulness is so astonishing, it stretches to the skies! May your shining glory be seen high above all the earth! Answer our prayer for your saving help. Come with your might and strength, for we need you, Lord ! and from his sanctuary I heard the Lord promise: “In my triumph I will be the one to measure out the portion of my inheritance to my people, and I will secure the land as I promised you. they are all still mine!” he says. “Judah will continue to produce kings and lawgivers, and Ephraim will produce great warriors. Moab will become my lowly servant. Edom will likewise serve my purposes. I will lift up a shout of victory over the land of Philistia! For to trust in any man is an empty hope. And with God’s help we’ll trample down our every foe!
Arise, my soul, and sing his praises!
Wherever I go, I will thank you.
Your love is so extravagant, it reaches higher than the heavens!
Lord God, be exalted as you soar throughout the heavens.
Come to your beloved ones and gently draw us out.
But who will bring my triumph into Edom’s fortresses?”
Lord, have you really rejected us, refusing to fight our battles?
Give us a father’s help when we face our enemies.
With God’s help we will prevail with might and power.

109.verse_text: God of all my praise, don’t stand silently by, aloof to my pain,

while the wicked slander me with their lies. Even right in front of my face they lie through their teeth. with their venomous words of hatred and vitriol. for what I’ve never done. They give me hatred when I show them love. like Satan himself standing right next to him. And let him be declared guilty by a wicked judge. May even his prayers be seen as sinful! like homeless vagabonds, evicted from their ruins! and strangers, like vultures, take all that’s left! remembered before you, forever! My heart is pierced through and I’m so wounded. Now I’m shriveled up, nothing but skin and bones. They just walk by me, shaking their heads. My true hero, come to my rescue and save me, for you are loving and kind. and they will all say to the Lord, “You have finished it!” but I know you will bless me! All their efforts to destroy me will fail, but I will succeed and be glad. Make them look ridiculous if they try to come against me. I’ve done nothing to them, but they still surround me

They continually repay me with evil when I show them good.

because he never once showed love or kindness to others,
Since he enjoyed cursing them,
Bitterness, such vile vindictiveness, was upon everything he did.

I’m so broken, needy and hurting.

The wicked slink away speechless in the darkness that falls, where hope dies and all their dreams fade away to nothing, nothing at all!

114.verse_text: Many years ago the Jewish people escaped Egypt’s tyranny,

so that Israel, God’s people of praise, would become his holy sanctuary, his kingdom on the earth. Then later, the Jordan River too moved aside so that they could all pass through. O Jordan, what was it that made you turn and run? And you hills, what made you shiver? the presence of the God of Jacob. Gushing streams burst forth when he is near !
The Red Sea waters saw them coming and ran the other way!
The land shuddered with fear. Mountains and hills shook with dread.
O sea, what happened to you to make you flee?
O mountains, what frightened you so?
Tremble, O earth, for you are in the presence of the Lord,
He splits open boulders and brings up bubbling water.

For you are the one who loves us passionately, and you are faithful and true. “Where is this God of yours?” and he takes delight in all that he does. their wealth and their work. and what they make with their hands, but their things can’t talk to them or answer their prayers. For he is the only true hero, the wraparound God who is our shield! For he is the only true hero, God-wrapped-around-us as our shield. Heaven’s mighty ones will hear my voice as I sing my loving praise to you. and bring you my deepest worship as I experience your tender love and your living truth. For your Word and the fame of your name You strengthened me deep within my soul and breathed fresh courage into me. will rise to give you thanks when they hear the living words that I have heard you speak. for your ineffable glory is great! you stoop to embrace the lowly. Yet you keep your distance from those filled with pride. and you will keep me alive, reviving me. Your power set me free from the hatred of my enemies. Since your love for me is constant and endless, I ask you, Lord, to finish every good thing that you’ve begun in me!
I bow down before your divine presence
At the very moment I called out to you, you answered me!
One day all the kings of the earth
They too will sing of your wonderful ways,
For though you are lofty and exalted,
By your mighty power I can walk through any devastation,
You keep every promise you’ve ever made to me!

139.verse_text: Lord, you know everything there is to know about me.

You perceive every movement of my heart and soul, and you understand my every thought before it even enters my mind. You read my heart like an open book and you know all the words I’m about to speak before I even start a sentence! You know every step I will take before my journey even begins. and in kindness you follow behind me You have laid your hand on me! Where could I run and hide from your face? If I go down to the realm of the dead, you’re there too! your strength will empower me. or to ask the darkness to hide me, for your presence is everywhere, bringing light into my night. The night, to you, is as bright as the day; there’s no difference between the two. and my intricate outside, Everything you do is marvelously breathtaking. It simply amazes me to think about it! How thoroughly you know me, Lord! Before I’d ever seen the light of day , the number of days you planned for me How precious and wonderful to consider that you cherish me constantly in your every thought! O God, your desires toward me are more than the grains of sand on every shore! When I awake each morning, you’re still with me. For I cry out, “Depart from me, you wicked ones!” and lift up themselves against you, but all in vain! For I grieve when I see them rise up against you. Your enemies shall be my enemies! Examine me through and through; find out everything that may be hidden within me. Put me to the test and sift through all my anxious cares. and lead me back to your glorious, everlasting way— the path that brings me back to you.

You’ve gone into my future to prepare the way, to spare me from the harm of my past. Your understanding of me brings me wonder and strength. If I fly into the radiant sunset, you’re there waiting! and wove them all together in my mother’s womb. when you created me in the secret place; carefully, skillfully you shaped me from nothing to something. were already recorded in your book.
This is just too wonderful, deep, and incomprehensible!
Where could I go from your Spirit?
If I go up to heaven, you’re there!
If I fly with wings into the shining dawn, you’re there!
Wherever I go, your hand will guide me;
It’s impossible to disappear from you
There is no such thing as darkness with you.
You formed my innermost being, shaping my delicate inside
I thank you, God, for making me so mysteriously complex!
You even formed every bone in my body
You saw who you created me to be before I became me!
O God, come and slay these bloodthirsty, murderous men!
See how they blaspheme your sacred name
Lord, can’t you see how I despise those who despise you?
I have nothing but complete hatred and disgust for them.
God, I invite your searching gaze into my heart.
See if there is any path of pain I’m walking on,

140.verse_text: Lord, protect me from this evil one! Rescue me from these violent schemes! stirring up trouble one against another. of poisonous, hateful words. Pause in his presence and guard me, God, for they have plotted an evil scheme to ruin me and bring me down. They are determined to snare me in their net like captured prey. Pause in his presence My Hero-God, you wrap yourself around me to protect me. For I’m surrounded by your presence in my day of battle. Lord Yahweh, hear my cry. May my voice move your heart to show me mercy. but bring down their every strategy to subdue me or they will become even more arrogant! Pause in his presence May they drink the poison of their own poisonous words. Let evil itself hunt them down and pursue them relentlessly until they are thrown into fiery pits from which they will never get out! Let burning coals of hellfire fall upon their heads! of all those they persecute, and you will secure justice for the poor. For they choose and cherish your presence above everything else!
He concocts his secret strategy to divide and harm others,
They are known for their sharp rhetoric
Keep me safe, Lord, out of reach from these wicked and violent men,
They are proud and insolent; they’ve set an ambush for me in secret.
Don’t let the wicked triumph over me,
Those who surround me are nothing but proud troublemakers.
For I know, Lord, that you will be the hero
Your godly ones will thank you no matter what happens.

141.verse_text: Please, Lord, come close and come quickly to help me! Listen to my prayer as I call out to you. that burns like fragrant incense, rising as my offering to you as I lift up my hands in surrendered worship! from speaking what is wrong. Save me from sinful habits and from keeping company with those who are experts in evil. Help me not to share in their sin in any way! or one of your faithful ones rebukes me, I will accept it like an honor I cannot refuse. It will be as healing medicine that I swallow without an offended heart. then they’ll know my words to them were true! so the world of hell will open its mouth to swallow their scattered bones. I hide myself in you, so don’t leave me defenseless. while I escape without a scratch!
Let my prayer be as the evening sacrifice
God, give me grace to guard my lips
Guide me away from temptation and doing evil.
When one of your godly ones corrects me Even if they are mistaken, I will continue to pray. falling upon the rocks of justice,
When the leaders and judges are condemned,
Like an earthquake splits open the earth,

Protect me! Keep me from the traps of wickedness they set for me.
Let them all stumble into their own traps

142.verse_text: God, I’m crying out to you! I lift up my voice boldly to beg for your mercy. you were the only one there to help. You gave me a way of escape from the hidden traps of my enemies. but there’s no one who takes notice of me. I have no hope of escape, and no one cares whether I live or die. You’re all I have, my only hope in this life, my last chance for help. for I am low and in desperate need of you! Rescue me from all those who persecute me, for I am no match for them. And all the righteous will celebrate all the wonderful things you’ve done for me!
I spill out my heart to you and tell you all my troubles.
For when I was desperate, overwhelmed, and about to give up,
I look to my left and right to see if there is anyone who will help,
So I cried out to you, Lord, my only hiding place.
Please listen to my heart’s cry,
Bring me out of this dungeon so I can declare your praise!

143.verse_text: Lord, you must hear my prayer, for you are faithful to your promises. Answer my cry, O righteous God! for there is no one who is righteous before you. and crushed my life into dust. Now I’m living in the darkness of death’s shadow. and my heart is heavy, dazed with despair. and I often think of all the wonders of old. like the dry, cracked ground thirsts for rain. So teach me, Lord, for you are my God. Your gracious Spirit is all I need, so lead me on good paths that are pleasing to you, my one and only God! for you are true to your promises. Bring me out of these troubles! who are trying to harm me. And because you are so loving and kind to me, silence all of my enemies!
Don’t bring me into your courtroom for judgment,
My enemies have chased and caught me

Now I’m reaching out to you, thirsting for you
Lord, come quickly and answer me,
Let the dawning day bring me revelation

I just want to obey all you ask of me.
Lord, if you rescue me, it will bring you more glory,
Since I am your loving servant, destroy all those

144.verse_text: There is only one strong, safe, and secure place for me; it’s in God alone who gives me strength for the battle. who wraps himself around me as a secure shield. I hide myself in this one who subdues enemies before me. Why do you even bother with us? We spend our days like nothing more than a passing shadow. Make the mountains melt at your touch. Overthrow them with your terrifying judgments. and rescue me from this hell and deliver me from these dark powers. Nothing they say can ever be trusted. The harp inside my heart will make music to you! the one who rescues David, your loving servant, from the fatal sword. who speak nothing but lies. Their words are pure deceit, and you can’t trust anything they say. Our sons will grow up as strong, sturdy men and our daughters with graceful beauty, royally fashioned as for a palace. overflowing with the fruits of our harvest. Our fields will be full of sheep and cattle, too many to count, and our livestock will not miscarry their young. Our enemies will not invade our land, and there’ll be no breach in our walls. The people who love and serve our God will be happy indeed!
He’s my shelter of love and my fortress of faith,
Lord, what is it about us that you would even notice us?
For man is nothing but a faint whisper, a mere breath.
Step down from heaven, Lord, and come down!
Loose your fiery lightning flashes and scatter your enemies.
They speak nothing but lies; their words are pure deceit.
My God, I will sing you a brand-new song!
I will sing of you, the one who gives victory to kings—
Deliver me and save me from these dark powers
Deliver us! Then our homes will be happy.
What bliss we experience when these blessings fall!

145.verse_text: My heart explodes with praise to you! Now and forever my heart bows in worship to you, my King and my God! with praises that will last throughout eternity. For there is no end to the discovery of the greatness that surrounds you. and declare more of your glory. are my constant meditation. I’m telling people everywhere about your excellent greatness! of your marvelous beauty, bringing bliss to our hearts . We shout with ecstatic joy over your breakthrough for us. and very patient with people who fail you. Your love is like a flooding river overflowing its banks with kindness. for your tender love is blended into everything you do. And all your godly ones will be found bowing before you. and preach about your limitless power. and reveal the glorious majesty of your kingdom. You are faithful to fulfill every promise you’ve made. Those bent over with burdens of shame you will lift up. and the eyes of all look to you. You give what they hunger for at just the right time. satisfying the longings of every living thing. and your love is wrapped into all your works. listening closely, especially when their hearts are true. even more than what they ask for. For you hear what their hearts really long for, and you bring them your saving strength. but you will destroy the ungodly. Let everyone everywhere join me in praising the beautiful Lord of holiness from now through eternity!
Every day I will lift up my praise to your name
Lord, you are great and worthy of the highest praise!
Generation after generation will declare more of your greatness
Your magnificent splendor and the miracles of your majesty
Your awe-inspiring acts of power have everyone talking!
Our hearts bubble over as we celebrate the fame
You’re kind and tenderhearted to those who don’t deserve it
God, everyone sees your goodness,
Everything you have made will praise you, fulfilling its purpose.
They will tell the world of the lavish splendor of your kingdom
They will demonstrate for all to see your miracles of might
You are the Lord who reigns over your never-ending kingdom through all the ages of time and eternity! You manifest yourself as kindness in all you do.
Weak and feeble ones you will sustain.
You have captured our attention
When you open your generous hand, it’s full of blessings,
You are fair and righteous in everything you do,
You draw near to those who call out to you,
Every godly one receives
God, you watch carefully over all your devoted lovers like a bodyguard,
I will praise you, Lord!

146.verse_text: Hallelujah! Praise the Lord! My innermost being will praise you, Lord! singing high praises to you, my God, every day of my life! no matter who they are, they can’t save us, for even our great leaders fail and fall. They too are just mortals who will one day die. At death the spirits of all depart and their bodies return to dust. In the day of their death all their projects and plans are over. Our help comes from the God of Jacob! You are the Creator of heaven’s glory, earth’s grandeur, and the ocean’s greatness. The hungry are satisfied with you. Prisoners find their freedom with you. and you fully restore those bent over with shame. You love those who love and honor you. and support the fatherless and widows. But you subvert the plans of the ungodly. Zion’s God will rule throughout time and eternity! Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!
I will spend my life praising you and
But those who hope in the Lord will be happy and pleased!
The oppressed get justice with you.
You open the eyes of the blind,
You watch over strangers and immigrants

147.verse_text: Hallelujah! Praise the Lord! How beautiful it is when we sing our praises to the beautiful God, for praise makes you lovely before him and brings him great delight! he gathers up the outcasts and brings them home. There’s absolutely nothing his power cannot accomplish, and he has infinite understanding of everything. but the ungodly will be brought down to the dust. Let’s sing our praises with melodies overflowing! so that the grass springs up on the mountain fields are fed from his hands. for horsepower is nothing to him. Manpower is even less impressive! He even blesses you with more children. feeding you the most excellent of fare. his words run as swift messengers, bringing them to pass. painting the landscape with frost. causing waters to freeze before winter’s icy blast. as the warm spring winds blow, the streams begin to flow. and to Israel he brings his life-giving instruction. for they have received his laws. Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!
Yahweh builds up Jerusalem;
He heals the wounds of every shattered heart.
He sets his stars in place, calling them all by their names.
How great is our God!
Yahweh supports and strengthens the humble,
Sing out with songs of thanksgiving to the Lord!
He fills the sky with clouds, sending showers to water the earth and the earth produces food for man. those who wait for his tender embrace.
All the birds and beasts who cry with hunger to him
His people don’t find security in strong horses,
Yahweh shows favor to those who fear him,
Jerusalem, praise the Lord! Zion, worship your God!
For he has strengthened the authority of your gates.
He’s the one who brings peace to your borders,
He sends out his orders throughout the world;
He blankets the earth with glistening snow,
Sleet and hail fall from the sky,
Then he speaks his word and it all melts away;
In the same way, he speaks his word to Jacob,
He has dealt with Israel differently than with any other people,

148.verse_text: Hallelujah! Praise the Lord! Let the skies be filled with praise and the highest heavens with the shouts of glory! Praise him some more, all you heavenly hosts! Don’t stop now, all you twinkling stars of light! He spoke and created it all—from nothing to something. and he stands behind his commands so his orders will never be revoked. You mighty creatures of the ocean’s depths, echo in exaltation! and the stormy winds that fulfill his word— trees of the forest and field, harmonize your praise! kings, queens, princes, and princesses, young men and maidens, children and babes, old and young alike, everyone everywhere! For the name of the Lord is the only name we raise! His stunning splendor ascends higher than the heavens. showing his great favor to all his godly lovers, even to his princely people, Israel, who are so close to his heart. Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!
Go ahead—praise him, all you his messengers!
Keep it up, sun and moon!
Take it up even higher—up to the highest heavens, until the cosmic chorus thunders his praise!
Let the entire universe erupt with praise to God.
He established the cosmos to last forever,
Let the earth join in with this parade of praise!
bring your melody, O mountains and hills;
Let them all join in with this orchestra of praise.
He anoints his people with strength and authority,

149.verse_text: Hallelujah! Praise the Lord! It’s time to sing to God a brand-new song so that all his holy people will hear how wonderful he is! and may the sons of Zion pour out their joyful praises to their King. Make music and sing God’s praises with the rhythm of drums! He adorns the humble with his beauty, and he loves to give them victory. and their joyful praises will rise even while others sleep. for their shouted praises are their weapons of war! on the nations and every resistant power— the judgment decreed against their enemies. This is the honor he gives to all his godly lovers. Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!
May Israel be enthused with joy because of him,
For he enjoys his faithful lovers.
His godly lovers triumph in the glory of God,
God’s high and holy praises fill their mouths,
These warring weapons will bring vengeance
to bind kings with chains and rulers with iron shackles.

150.verse_text: Hallelujah! Praise the Lord! Praise God in his holy sanctuary! Praise him in his stronghold in the sky! Praise him for his magnificent greatness! Praise him with piano and guitar! Praise him with loud clashing of cymbals! Praise him upon the high-sounding cymbals! of ecstatic praise to Yahweh! Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!
Praise him for his mighty miracles!
